instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LVDS_DDC_CLK: What is LVDS_DDC_CLK? LVDS_DDC_CLK Is the DDC clock line between the graphics processor and the screen. DDC is a protocol for identifying a screen so that you know what resolution/refresh rate it wants. This is necessary for screen detection, inductor on this data line must be good and DDC voltage must be going to the LCD screen for it to work. .

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
so there's this macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , which came in with corrosion on L9080, backlight is on, there's keyboard backlit too, i can see the caps lock light too,
pin 2 3 4 j9000 is 3.3v
I replace L9080, try diode mode from pin 8-15 is 0.514, is this pch problem ?

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Are you sure L9080 is OK now?
I would use direct wires instead.

Did you try known good compatible LCD assembly?
Check all traces around J9000; you may need to replace it too.

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Ok i will try new connector
First, the L9080 doesn't have continuity to its front, now it have after i replace it, is there any measurement i can make on L9080?

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Just be sure both lines have continuity over the coils...

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Changing connector, still the same, then is this pch?

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Do you get black screen, or pure white?

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
(SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Do you have continuity from pins 17/18 of the LCD connector to the other side of L9080? 

Black screen/backlight on these can very well be a dead PCH or crap under it. 

I presume you have tried another display?

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: damn, pin 17 doesnt make its way to l9080, newbie mistake here, thanks 2informaticos and tcrs , solved..

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Check diode mode and voltage at <SIGNAL>LVDS_DDC_CLK</SIGNAL>/DATA lines.
Do the same for the other LVDS data lines.
Be sure L9004/08 have really 0 ohm resistance.

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: no.., I mean the problem is solved, I run a wire from pin 17 to l9089.., thanks a lot..

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Glad this is solved. Broken traces can troll you!
